ygData.subject: Re: New Equipment
ygData.msgSnippet: With all of the great wisdom items floating around, you really should have no problem with armor.    I m now at 170 wisdom and am approx 62/79 when I have no
ygData.messageBody:
With all of the great wisdom items floating around, you really should have
no problem with armor. I'm now at 170 wisdom and am approx 62/79 when I
have no items in my inventory. One drawback to this is my AC is only 565,
but I dont get hit much being a cleric...:)

Mr. J Daniels


On Fri, 9 Jul 1999, Pam Arbogast wrote:

> From: Pam Arbogast <adira399@...>
>
> Ahhh, I like that idea! But, I feel a cleric's shield should also help
> with some strength, especially since we need it to equip our armor. My
> high elf cleric is now decked out in ringmail and is way too heavy for
> her. Since she's usually grouped with some well taunting tanks, this
> doesn't matter much to me, but when I solo I can barely move. Why dont
> I wear lighter armor? Simple, my spells wiped out my bank account and
> I'm trying to be self sufficient and avoiding the whole "twinking"
> thing! I dislike twinkies. I wear what I find, I buy what I can
> afford and I dont walk, I waddle!
>
>
> --- "Squires, Dean" <DeanSquires@...> wrote:
> > From: "Squires, Dean"
> > <DeanSquires@...>
> >
> > What I'd like to see is a bi-monthly rotation of
> > items. Have you
> > noticed how common Shiny Brass Sheilds (AC+10, SV+
> > 10) are nowadays?
> > I'd like the trainer to "go away" JUST for 2 months,
> > and have him
> > replaced with a goblin or kobold NPC carrying a
> > Cleric's shield (with
> > stats such as AC+9, WIS+3, STR+3). This would
> > increase the variety of
> > items in the game, but not the number as such, AND
> > make the Shiny Brass
> > Shield more valuable!
> >
> > I know that this will reflect the Screaming Mace
> > Quest, so this would
> > have to go hand in hand with a new Cleric quest
> > weapon. How about the
> > Knight Star (a quest Morning Star). That sounds
> > cool. A weapon that
> > casts a low level heal on the user each round would
> > be nice!
> >
> > Baelstorm
> >
> > > -----Original Message-----
> > > From: Allsar [SMTP:bogey@...]
> > > Sent: Thursday, July 08, 1999 7:05 PM
> > > To: EQ-Clerics@onelist.com
> > > Subject: Re: [EQ-Clerics] Soul Fire
> > >
> > > From: "Allsar" <bogey@...>
> > >
> > > I agree that we need some good quest item. It
> > doesn't have to be some
> > > awsome 1hb that does 15 dmg with 40 delay or
> > something like that.
> > > Somehting
> > > like a 2hb with charges of mana regen, or like
> > what Lohre said, +7 wis
> > > would
> > > be really ncie also. Have like 12 dmg delay 36
> > with +7 wisdom, cleric
> > > only
> > > and i'd be really happy.
> > > Allsar Olath`Vlos - 25th level - Rathe
> > > -----Original Message-----
> > > From: Mike Schlagenhauf <trelane@...>
> > > To: EQ-Clerics@onelist.com
> > <EQ-Clerics@onelist.com>
> > > Date: Thursday, July 08, 1999 4:26 PM
> > > Subject: Re: [EQ-Clerics] Soul Fire
> > >
> > >
> > > >From: "Mike Schlagenhauf" <trelane@...>
> > > >
> > > ><devil's advocate>
> > > >True, but how much of a tank/solo class is a
> > cleric compared to a
> > > paladin?
> > > >And if there were to be a cleric super-weapon,
> > would it be 1h or 2h?
> > > I
> > > know
> > > >personally I'd want 1h mace or hammer, but there
> > are plenty of people
> > > who'd
> > > >want a nice 2h staff.
> > > ></devil's advocate>
> > > >
> > > >That aside, I agree, I've not found much in the
> > way of a 1h blunt
> > > weapon
> > > >that does more than 9 dmg, and certainly none
> > that have those sort of
> > > side
> > > >benefits. I know I'd love to have a weapon that
> > alone just added
> > > another 7
> > > >wis to my character. I've just read on EQ'Lizer
> > that "two or three"
> > > >paladins already have them, and they're about lv
> > 18. That screams to
> > > me
> > > >that either the game balance is about to be
> > completely upended by a
> > > single
> > > >weapon (just my opinion from seeing the same sort
> > of weapon
> > > implementation
> > > >on MUDs that I played), or that they're going to
> > get something even
> > > better
> > > >that takes a higher level to accomplish the
> > quest. All in all, I
> > > agree,
> > > I'd
> > > >like to see some more powerful 1h blunt,
> > something with more than
> > > 9dmg
> > > >(maybe there is something like that, I just
> > haven't heard about it
> > > yet).
> > > >--
> > > >Mike Schlagenhauf
> > > >trelane@...
> > > >Lohre
> > > >Ambassador of <Lifeforce Brigade>
> > > >Bristlebane Server
> > > >
> > > >----- Original Message -----
> > > >From: Azor <jmaynus@...>
> > > >To: <EQ-Clerics@onelist.com>
> > > >Sent: Thursday, July 08, 1999 4:12 PM
> > > >Subject: Re: [EQ-Clerics] Soul Fire
> > > >
> > > >
> > > >> From: "Azor" <jmaynus@...>
> > > >>
> > > >> The Soul Fire Sword is Charges 5, 2HD Slashing,
> > ATK Delay 45, DMG
> > > 23, STR
> > > >> +7, WIS +7, Effect: Complete Healing, WT 5.0
> > Class Pal.
> > > >> Thats not fair, Clerics should get something
> > like this but instade
> > > of
> > > >sword
> > > >> it can be a mace or hammer or a staff.
> > > >>
> > > >> **************************
> > > >> Azor
